SEARCH
Module org.jandle
Package org.jandle.api.ratelimiter

Class RateLimiter

java.lang.Object
org.jandle.api.ratelimiter.RateLimiter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Filter, Releasable
public class RateLimiter extends Object implements Filter, Releasable
Filter implementation that applies per-client rate limiting using the token bucket algorithm.

Each client (identified by IP address) is assigned an independent TokenBucket. Tokens are replenished continuously over time. If a request arrives when insufficient tokens are available, the request is rejected with HTTP 429 Too Many Requests.

Algorithm

  • Each bucket has a fixed maximum capacity.
  • Tokens are added at a constant rate (tokensPerSecond).
  • Each incoming request consumes one token.

Rate Limit Headers

This filter sets standard and de-facto rate limit headers on every response:

  • RateLimit-Limit / X-RateLimit-Limit
  • RateLimit-Remaining / X-RateLimit-Remaining
  • RateLimit-Reset / X-RateLimit-Reset
  • RateLimit-Policy / X-RateLimit-Policy

When a request is rejected, Retry-After and X-Retry-After headers are also included.

Storage Abstraction

The filter delegates bucket storage to a TokenStorage implementation, allowing the rate limiter to work with in-memory, distributed, or persistent storage backends.

Concurrency

Synchronization is performed at the individual bucket level, minimizing contention between unrelated clients.

      tokensPerSecond - token refill rate
      idleTimeoutNanos - maximum idle time before bucket cleanup

  • Method Details

    • doFilter

      public void doFilter(Request httpRequest, Response httpResponse, Chain filterChain) throws IOException
      Applies rate limiting to the incoming httpRequest.

      Each httpRequest consumes one token from the client's bucket. If no token is available, the httpRequest is rejected with HTTP 429 and appropriate rate limit headers are set.

      When rate limiting is applied, standard and legacy rate limit headers are added to the httpResponse regardless of whether the httpRequest is accepted or rejected.

      Specified by:
      doFilter in interface Filter
      Parameters:
      httpRequest - incoming httpRequest
      httpResponse - outgoing httpResponse
      filterChain - filter filterChain
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while handling the httpResponse

    • release

      public void release()
      Shuts down resources associated with this rate limiter.

      This method delegates to the underlying TokenStorage and should be invoked during application shutdown.

      Specified by:
      release in interface Releasable
